name: slack-add-emoji-reaction
description: Add an emoji reaction to a message. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/reactions.add)

conversation.description: Channel where the message to add reaction to was posted.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the message to add reaction to. e.g. `1403051575.000407`.

icon_emoji.description: Provide an emoji to use as the icon for this reaction. E.g. `fire`

name: slack-approve-workflow
description: Suspend the workflow until approved by a Slack message. [See the documentation](https://pipedream.com/docs/code/nodejs/rerun#flowsuspend)

channelType.description: The type of channel to send to. User/Direct Message (im), Group (mpim), Private Channel or Public Channel

message.description: Text to include with the Approve and Cancel Buttons

name: slack-archive-channel
description: Archive a channel. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/conversations.archive)

name: slack-create-channel
description: Create a new channel. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/conversations.create)

channelName.description: Name of the public or private channel to create

isPrivate.description: `false` by default. Pass `true` to create a private channel instead of a public one.

name: slack-create-reminder
description: Create a reminder. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/reminders.add)

timestamp.description: When this reminder should happen: the Unix timestamp (up to five years from now), the number of seconds until the reminder (if within 24 hours), or a natural language description (Ex. in 15 minutes, or every Thursday)

name: slack-delete-file
description: Delete a file. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/files.delete)

name: slack-delete-message
description: Delete a message. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/chat.delete)

as_user.description: Pass true to update the message as the authed user. Bot users in this context are considered authed users.

name: slack-find-message
description: Find a Slack message. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/search.messages)

maxResults.description: The maximum number of messages to return

sort.description: Return matches sorted by either `score` or `timestamp`

name: slack-find-user-by-email
description: Find a user by matching against their email. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/users.lookupByEmail)

name: slack-get-file
description: Return information about a file. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/files.info)

name: slack-invite-user-to-channel
description: Invite a user to an existing channel. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/conversations.invite)

name: slack-kick-user
description: Remove a user from a conversation. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/conversations.kick)

name: slack-list-channels
description: Return a list of all channels in a workspace. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/conversations.list)

name: slack-list-files
description: Return a list of files within a team. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/files.list)

name: slack-list-group-members
description: List all users in a User Group. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/usergroups.users.list)

team.description: Encoded team id where the user group exists, required if org token is used.

name: slack-list-members-in-channel
description: Retrieve members of a channel. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/conversations.members)

returnUsernames.description: Optionally, return usernames in addition to IDs

name: slack-list-replies
description: Retrieve a thread of messages posted to a conversation. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/conversations.replies)

name: slack-list-users
description: Return a list of all users in a workspace. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/users.list)

name: slack-set-channel-description
description: Change the description or purpose of a channel. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/conversations.setPurpose)

name: slack-set-channel-topic
description: Set the topic on a selected channel. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/conversations.setTopic)

name: slack-set-status
description: Set the current status for a user. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/users.profile.set)

statusEmoji.description: The emoji to display with the status

statusExpiration.description: The datetime of when the status will expire in ISO 8601 format. (Example: `2014-01-01T00:00:00Z`)

name: slack-update-group-members
description: Update the list of users for a User Group. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/usergroups.users.update)

usersToAdd.description: A list of encoded user IDs that represent the users to add to the group.

usersToRemove.description: A list of encoded user IDs that represent the users to remove from the group.

team.description: Encoded team id where the user group exists, required if org token is used.

name: slack-update-message
description: Update a message. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/chat.update)

as_user.description: Pass true to update the message as the authed user. Bot users in this context are considered authed users.

name: slack-update-profile
description: Update basic profile field such as name or title. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/methods/users.profile.set)

displayName.description: The display name the user has chosen to identify themselves by in their workspace profile

phone.description: The user's phone number, in any format

email.description: The user's email address. You cannot update your own email using this method. This field can only be changed by admins for users on paid teams.

user.description: ID of user to change. This argument may only be specified by admins on paid teams.

name: slack-upload-file
description: Upload a file. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/messaging/files#uploading_files)

initialComment.description: Will be added as an initial comment before the image

name: slack-verify-slack-signature
description: Verifying requests from Slack, slack signs its requests using a secret that's unique to your app. [See the documentation](https://api.slack.com/authentication/verifying-requests-from-slack)

slackSigningSecret.description: Slack [Signing Secret](https://api.slack.com/authentication/verifying-requests-from-slack#:~:text=Slack%20Signing%20Secret%2C%20available%20in%20the%20app%20admin%20panel%20under%20Basic%20Info.), available in the app admin panel under Basic Info.

requestBody.description: The body of the request to be verified.
